intro: Launea, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, the Middle East, and parts of southern Asia. Launea species are typically shrubs or small trees, characterized by their hairy stems and yellow or orange flowers. The leaves are usually alternate, often with a waxy coating to reduce water loss. These plants are well adapted to drought conditions, making them important components of desert ecosystems.
